title: Ojima-ojo
author: Ojima-ojo
content: Quote from: Ojima-ojo on May 17, 2022, 09:39:13 PMAm still new in this space both in cryptocurrency and in this forum and seeing what is happening even to stable coins lately make me decide to put all my investment funds into Bitcoin since Bitcoin has never crashed or a billion coins getting minted out of no we're and dump into the market just like Luna tereUSTD did, so for your peace of mind I advise newbies to rely only on highly decentralized crypto Bitcoin. Until you learn enough to decide which risk to take and which not to.After making the above quoted thread, to show my enthusiasm and commitment to Bitcoin accumulation as a newbie I did not rush myself or getting myself work up with the price of Bitcoin rather I concentrated on on building my knowledge on Bitcoin and it development over time and how the market behavior has been and after gaining some level of knowledge i then started my Bitcoin accumulation bits by bits no matter how small I could and today my I have 1 million Satoshi in my wallet making me to be ranked among the Satoshi millionaires, even though my achievement of becoming a Satoshi millionaire may sound as a small achievement to most people here. I am super excited to have become a Satoshi millionaire today and am going to hold on to this and also accumulate more subsequently.

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Quote from: Ojima-ojo on September 23, 2022, 07:40:36 AMI am super excited to have become a Satoshi millionaire today and am going to hold on to this and also accumulate more subsequently.It is advicable to keep any future accumulations private. How much BTC you own is not something you publicly announce here on the forum, or anywhere else, especially to people who know you personally.Another advice would be storage methods. Since you're on the forum, you'll probably know the most recommended wallet softwares are electrum and Bitcoin core. For higher amounts of Bitcoin, it would be wise to invest in a hardware wallet.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: Upgrade00 on September 23, 2022, 07:47:05 AMIt is advicable to keep any future accumulations private. How much BTC you own is not something you publicly announce here on the forum, or anywhere else, especially to people who know you personally.Exactly, it is good to be private.Quote from: Upgrade00 on September 23, 2022, 07:47:05 AMAnother advice would be storage methods. Since you're on the forum, you'll probably know the most recommended wallet softwares are electrum and Bitcoin core. For higher amounts of Bitcoin, it would be wise to invest in a hardware wallet.For frequent transactions, hardware wallet would be advisable. Or a watch-only wallet (watch-only wallet for tracking transaction, generating unsigned transaction and also for broadcasting signed transaction), and its cold storage (for transaction signing).For save keeping, also other cold wallets generated on airgapped devices are recommendable. I mean paper wallet generated on airgapped device, and also a wallet on airgapped device. As long as the person is not spending from it. He can just be tracking transactions with watch-only wallet using master public key import.

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Congratulations to have reached this first milestone! If I can give you my advice, now try to consolidate the various inputs you have received. As soon as the mempool has a few TXs to process, send them to a new address of your property to minimize the fees to be paid (likewise just 1 sat/byte).Find below some information about that...https://bitcoinbriefly.com/utxo-consolidation-explained/https://buybitcoinworldwide.com/fee-calculator/

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Congratulations, now it's time to go for 2 million.May your case be a lesson to most people who think 1 whole bitcoin is "expensive" because of its unit price, even though you don't necessarily need to buy 1 unit in one go.

comments.author: Cuda911
comments.body: For everyone saying its good to be private how the heck will I look for Ojima-ojo contact and track him to his house? Or do Bitcoin profile have home address filling the gap that I don't know about? Or you can now trace someone account to their home land?.. This forum is privacy on its own, no vital information that can put users at risk.

comments.author: DeathAngel
comments.body: Congratulations OP, now is not the time to stop though. Keep accumulating, you can always add to your stash. Dollar cost average every single month, keep going. Nobody has enough bitcoin.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: Quote from: Cuda911 on September 23, 2022, 08:45:01 AMOr do Bitcoin profile have home address filling the gap that I don't know about? Or you can now trace someone account to their home land?.. This forum is privacy on its own, no vital information that can put users at risk.It is better to be safe anyway. Who knows, we are prone to fault. Sometimes we put our throwaway social media accounts but then one or two of them are connected to our main one for example, or we forgot to put our e-mail private, or in the worst case scenario there might be a database leak from the forum in the future. Scammers then use the info to send phishing e-mail or hack into our PC because we said we own some BTC, and so on. Btw congrats OP, may you own 1 BTC soon.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Small or big we acquired satoshi I think we are all lucky to be this early on being affiliated to bitcoin. Having more knowledge is essential but experience is also a key to be on this game. Most of the users are simply doing dca and this is good chance for us since the price of bitcoin is tanking. We dont know how long it will stay at that price so we just keep accumulating until the price appreciated and we could sell and gain some sats in a longer period. Bear will not be forever, so lets just be patience. Congrats OP for being proud of your holding.

comments.author: Darker45
comments.body: You've done a great job. Congratulations! While it is indeed a lot better to have known Bitcoin much earlier and bought much, there is nothing we can do about it. So instead of crying over spilled milk, it is better to do something now. The right time, after all, is always now. We don't even have to make up for the time that we missed. We don't have to spend so much or even borrow or take a loan just to become a full-Bitcoin HODLer. There's no need to reach for the stars right away. It is enough to do things little by little.

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: OP, congratulations on reaching the million mark. As they say, the first million is the hardest.  Your next milestone is ten million satoshi. Good luck!

comments.author: JangoUnchained
comments.body: You've performed the right thing, I can't dream of a better crypto portfolio without BTC being a part, it's what we called incomplete, now your next target should be 2/million, do not give up on this journey as it will reward extremely in the near future, one step at a time.

comments.author: salad daging
comments.body: I'm happy to hear that you have owned a Satoshi millionaire, it proves that you have been consistent in investing and believe in the only coin, namely Bitcoin, compared to others, I'm glad to hear that you have reached the first stage and hope to continue to accumulate Bitcoin in the future.I myself am still at the bottom stage to reach 1 million Satoshi but I keep doing this with DCA strategy every week I invest, but still too far to reach 1 BTC but I hope I will also soon to have a Satoshi millionaire like you.
